author: Alicia Diaz
description: The Republican-controlled Senate narrowly passed a bill to end Donald Trump’s tariffs on Canada, highlighting GOP divisions over the duties just days after the president threatened to increase them further to punish the US’s northern neighbor.
title: Senate Rebuffs Trump on Canada Tariffs Amid GOP Dissent on Trade

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: Ukraine and its allies have called on Donald Trump to pressure Xi Jinping over China’s support for Russia. Trump’s meeting with Xi later Thursday will be a major test of just how ready the US president is to get tough with Vladimir Putin.
title: Trump’s Russia Oil Sanctions Face Early Test in China Meeting

author: Josh Sisco, Leah Nylen
description: President Donald Trump plans to nominate Ryan Baasch, a staffer at the National Economic Council, for a slot on the US Federal Trade Commission, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump to Name White House Aide Baasch as FTC Commissioner

author: Jordan Fabian
description: Any agreement will probably be a reset rather than a comprehensive accord.
title: Trump, Xi Likely to Pursue Trade Truce, Not Transformation, at Summit

author: Katharina Rosskopf, Patrick Van Oosterom, Wout Vergauwen
description: Geert Wilders’ far-right Freedom Party and the progressive Democrats 66 party are in a virtual tie in the Dutch parliamentary election Wednesday, as voters threw support behind more traditional centrist political groups.
title: Dutch Far Right Loses Ground in Elections as Centrists Gain

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Finance Minister Francois Philippe-Champagne says the upcoming Canadian budget will include measures to reduce the size of the federal public service.
title: Canada to Shrink Civil Service, Champagne Says Ahead of Budget

author: Samy Adghirni
description: French President Emmanuel Macron called for a ban on social media that fail to disclose their political bias and said platforms are undermining democracy across the world.
title: Macron Says Social Media That Don’t Disclose Bias Must Be Banned

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll, Vinicius Andrade, Nicolle Yapur
description: Argentine provinces and companies are lining up to tap global markets in the next few weeks as President Javier Milei’s win in midterm elections fuels optimism about the country, opening a window for debt sales that could bring much needed dollars into the nation’s foreign-exchange market.
title: Argentine Peso to Get Boost From Post-Election Debt Sales Rush

author: Jamie Tarabay, Roxana Tiron
description: A key Democratic senator on Wednesday blasted the Trump administration for pushing Congress to the sidelines on critical national security issues, including military pay during the government shutdown, strikes on alleged drug boats off the Venezuelan coast and assistance to Argentina.
title: Trump’s Unilateral Security Moves Draw Backlash in Both Parties

author: Zoe Schneeweiss
description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde renewed her call to revamp the way decisions are taking within the European Union, pushing for majority voting to improve how the bloc functions.
title: ECB’s Lagarde Says Veto Power Holds ‘Vulnerable’ EU Hostage

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Italy’s court of auditors rejected government plans to build a €13.5 billion ($15.6 billion) bridge linking Sicily to the mainland, in a significant setback to one of Giorgia Meloni’s key initiatives.
title: Italy Court Rejects $15.6 Billion Sicily Bridge Project

author: Andrew Rosati, Gabriel Diniz Tavares
description: Brazil’s justice minister criticized a historically lethal police operation that left at least 119 people dead in Rio de Janeiro, chastising local officials for leaning on “brute strength” to try to root out drug gangs that operate across the city.
title: Lula ‘Appalled’ by Deadly Police Raids in Rio, Minister Says

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile presidential front-runner José Antonio Kast said his hardline migration policies would spur a larger share of undocumented migrants to self-deport than in the US under head of state Donald Trump.
title: Chile Presidential Favorite Kast Wants to Outdo Donald Trump on Self-Deportations

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Zohran Mamdani’s lead in the New York City mayor’s race over former Governor Andrew Cuomo has narrowed less than a week before Election Day, a Quinnipiac University poll found.
title: Mamdani’s Lead Over Cuomo Narrows in New York City Mayor’s Race

description: Rachel Reeves faces a set of difficult — and potentially election promise-breaking decisions — as she seeks to close a yawning gap in the public finances when she draws up the UK’s annual budget next month.
title: Raising UK Taxes Tops List of Reeves’ Budget Repair Options

author: Alicia Diaz, Lillianna Byington
description: A moderate Senate Democrat cast doubt on prospects for resolving the US government shutdown soon despite mounting consequences including an imminent cutoff of the most important federal food assistance program for low-income Americans.
title: Key Democratic Senator Pessimistic on Resolving US Shutdown Soon

description: The United Nations General Assembly again called for the end of the US embargo on Cuba, but the number of countries backing the annual push shrank after Washington pushed other countries to vote against it.
title: US Persuades 16 Countries to Change Vote on Cuba Embargo at UN

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: The federal government shutdown has already cost the US economy at least $18 billion this year, a figure that “will intensify” in the weeks to come, according to the Congressional Budget Office.
title: Government Shutdown Has Already Cost US Economy $18 Billion This Year, CBO Says

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said that negotiations for a trade deal with the US were ongoing and voiced optimism for an agreement, without providing a clear timeframe.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Hopes For A US Trade Deal ‘Fairly Soon’

author: Josh Wingrove, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping are set to finalize a détente as they meet Thursday in South Korea, putting the world’s biggest trade fight on hold — at least for now.
title: Trump, Xi Set to Formalize Trade Truce After Months of Chaos

author: Erik Larson, Madlin Mekelburg
description: President Donald Trump’s efforts to send troops to Democratic-led cities will face their biggest legal test yet starting Wednesday with a trial over the his power to deploy the National Guard to Portland, Oregon, to counter protests.
title: Trump’s Power to Deploy Troops to Cities Faces First Trial Test

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Zoltan Simon
description: US President Donald Trump plans to meet Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban on Nov. 8, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Plans to Meet Hungarian Premier Orban on Nov. 8

author: Jasmina Kuzmanovic, Misha Savic
description: The US lifted sanctions from Milorad Dodik after the longtime Bosnian Serb leader stepped down as president of Republika Srpska.
title: US Lifts Sanctions Against Former Bosnian Serb Leader Dodik

author: Jim Wyss
description: Trinidad y Tobago ha respaldado los ataques de Estados Unidos a presuntos traficantes de Venezuela. Éste respondió suspendiendo acuerdos de suministro de gas.
title: Cómo Trump consiguió un aliado caribeño en su guerra marítima antidrogas

author: Melissa Shin
description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford called on US Ambassador Pete Hoekstra to say he’s sorry for cursing in public at the Canadian province’s trade representative over a television ad that riled up President Donald Trump.
title: Ontario Premier Asks US Envoy to Apologize for Profane Rant

author: Simon Marks
description: World leaders called for renewed talks to halt the war in Sudan, as reports emerged of widespread atrocities in a city recently captured by the paramilitary group fighting the army-backed government.
title: Sudan War Sparks Global Alarm After Reports of Mass Killings

author: Misha Savic
description: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic appealed to the US for more time to resolve Gazprom’s control of the country’s sole refiner as the latest sanctions threaten to hit banks and card companies.
title: Serbia Urges US to Ease Pressure Over Sanctioned Gazprom Refiner

author: Ray Ndlovu
description: Zimbabwe’s President Emmerson Mnangagwa was forced to deliver part of his state-of-the-nation address by torchlight on Tuesday — showing that even he isn’t spared the country’s persistent power cuts.
title: State of the Nation: Zimbabwe President Speaks Under Torchlight

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuania closed its border with Belarus for a month as the premier denounced disruptions to air traffic caused by smugglers’ balloons as a hybrid attack.
title: Lithuania Closes Border With Belarus Citing ‘Hybrid Attack’

author: Alex Wickham, Ellen Milligan
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer refused to rule out raising income tax, national insurance or value added tax at the coming budget, suggesting the Labour government may break its election manifesto promises in order to help Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves fill a growing fiscal hole.
title: Starmer Opens Door to Raising Main UK Taxes in November’s Budget

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Russia said it tested a nuclear-powered torpedo days after its military hailed a trial of a long-distance cruise missile.
title: Putin Says Russia Tested Nuclear-Powered Torpedo

author: Joe Mayes
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said she aims to outperform anemic growth forecasts for Britain’s economy, as she reiterated warnings of tough choices on tax and spending at her upcoming budget.
title: UK’s Reeves Vows to Beat OBR Forecasts as Tough Budget Looms

author: Souhail Karam
description: Moroccan authorities charged more than 2,400 people over their involvement in recent youth-led protests against the high cost of preparations to co-host the 2030 men’s football World Cup.
title: Moroccan Authorities Charge 2,400 People Over GenZ Protests

author: Pius Lukong
description: Cameroon blamed the opposition for post-election violence and said several people had died following the contested result, which handed 92-year-old President Paul Biya an eighth term in office.
title: Cameroon Blames Opposition Leader for Post-Election Violence

author: Jim Wyss
description: Trinidad and Tobago’s prime minister has backed US strikes against alleged traffickers from Venezuela, which retaliated by cutting off gas deals.
title: Trump’s Campaign to Blow Up Boats in Drug War Gets a Caribbean Ally

author: Salma El Wardany
description: Finance chiefs flocking to Saudi Arabia for its showpiece business forum might have expected to hear the powerful son of a ruling dynasty woo them with grandiose plans.
title: Warlord Haftar’s Son Touts Libya as Business Hub at Saudi Summit

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Chad is inviting investors and donors to Abu Dhabi as the West African nation seeks financing for a $30 billion plan to develop trade corridors, critical-minerals mines and agricultural projects.
title: Chad Seeks Backers for $30 Billion Five-Year Development Plan

author: Allison McNeely
description: President Donald Trump’s move to let private equity and cryptocurrency become bigger pieces of the average retirement saver’s portfolio could lead to financial harm for millions of Americans, Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren and independent Senator Bernie Sanders said.
title: Warren, Sanders Say PE in 401(K)s Is ‘Dangerous’ for Americans

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland’s government expects high US tariffs to impact its revenue from value-added tax from next year as the levies weigh on growth.
title: Swiss Expect US Tariffs to Hit Tax Revenue From Next Year

author: Jonathan Gilbert, Bob Van Voris
description: The government of Argentine President Javier Milei is hoping its string of recent political and economic victories continues in a Manhattan courtroom as it seeks to overturn a $16 billion US court judgment against the South American nation.
title: Buoyed by Trump, Argentina Takes Aim at $16 Billion US Judgment

author: Christoph Rauwald, Richard Bravo
description: Signs point to more centrist groups dominating the next governing alliance.
title: Europe Watches Which Way Dutch Voters Will Go in Election

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: India and the European Union negotiators will meet next week to iron out sensitive issues, including trade barriers on steel and automobiles, as both sides race to finalize a trade deal by the end of the year.
title: India and EU to Hold Talks Next Week in Race to Seal Trade Pact

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland is changing the structure of its military as the neutral nation beefs up defense capabilities in response to a more fragile European security situation.
title: Switzerland Restructures Military to Boost Defense Capabilities

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Minutes before Air Force One touched down in South Korea, US President Donald Trump issued a terse missive on social media: “For those that are asking, we didn’t come to South Korea to see Canada!”
title: Trump Dines With Carney Despite Anger Over Tariff Commercial

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump said he reached a trade agreement with South Korea as he attended a dinner hosted by South Korean President Lee Jae Myung at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit.
title: Trump Says He Reached A Deal On Trade With South Korea

author: Benoit Berthelot, William Horobin
description: French lawmakers voted to double its tax on large technology companies, risking a backlash from Donald Trump who has long threatened to retaliate against the measure with trade tariffs.
title: France Risks Trump Ire as Lawmakers Vote to Raise Big Tech Tax

author: Tavares Cebola, Paul Burkhardt, Matthew Hill
description: An Islamist insurgency that froze TotalEnergies SE’s $24.5-billion gas project in Mozambique four years ago is intensifying, just as the French oil major prepares to restart development.
title: Mozambique’s $25 Billion LNG Revival Defies Resurging Violence

author: Samanth Subramanian
description: Designed by a German incel, the FGC-9 was created in a distinctly American spirit.
title: The Popular 3D-Printed Gun Globalizing the Second Amendment

author: Carla Canivete
description: Israel said it had began re-enforcing a ceasefire in Gaza, after the army conducted air strikes overnight in retaliation for a lethal Palestinian attack against its troops.
title: Israeli Army Says Ceasefire in Gaza Has Resumed After Strikes

author: Andra Timu, Jorge Valero
description: The US will scale down its troop presence in some of the countries on NATO’s eastern flank, Romania’s defense ministry said, as the administration of President Donald Trump reviews its military footprint in Europe.
title: Romania Says US Will Pull Troops From Some of Eastern Europe

author: Tooba Khan
description: Pakistan is considering sending troops to Gaza as part of a proposed peacekeeping force under a truce brokered earlier this month by US President Donald Trump, Pakistan’s defense minister said.
title: Pakistan Mulls Sending Troops to Gaza Under Trump Peace Plan

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung asked US President Donald Trump to allow Seoul to get supplies of nuclear fuel for submarines and to revise a decades-old nuclear energy agreement as the two leaders met Wednesday in Gyeongju.
title: South Korea’s Lee Asks Trump to Revise Decades-Old Nuclear Pact

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysia’s improved bilateral relationship with the US has strengthened the Southeast Asian country’s position in its negotiation on potential semiconductor tariffs, according to a minister.
title: Malaysia Says in Better Position to Negotiate Any US Chip Tariff

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump said he threatened India and Pakistan with 250% tariffs to help spur the resolution of their conflict earlier this year, describing Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi as “the nicest-looking guy” who is also a “killer” eager to fight.
title: Trump Says He Threatened 250% Tariffs on ‘Killer’ Modi, Pakistan

author: Hallie Gu, Alfred Cang
description: China has bought at least two cargoes of US soybeans, its first known purchase this season, which may mark a revival of flows as part of a wider settlement expected to be agreed between the two biggest economies this week.
title: China Purchases First Cargoes of US Soybeans This Season

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Charlotte Hughes-Morgan
description: After two years of political turmoil under the most right-wing administration in recent history, Dutch voters will head to the polls Wednesday to decide if they’ll chart a new path.
title: Dutch Election to Weigh a Return to the Center

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said the US has a “special bond” with South Korea as he addressed a meeting of corporate leaders at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit on Wednesday in Gyeongju.
title: Trump Says US Is ‘Wedded’ to South Korea, Optimistic on Trade

author: Kamran Haider
description: Pakistan said its talks with Afghanistan’s Taliban failed to bring a “workable solution” after the regime didn’t give assurances to stop cross-border militancy, raising concern deadly clashes between the neighbors may resume.
title: Pakistan Says Peace Talks With Afghanistan’s Taliban Failed

author: Alastair Gale
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth praised Japan’s new resolve to bolster its military a day after President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi agreed to deepen US-Japan defense ties.
title: Hegseth Calls Japan’s Defense Spending Plans ‘Wonderful’

author: Neil Jerome Morales
description: Two Philippine senators and two other former lawmakers will be recommended to face plunder charges over a corruption scandal in flood infrastructure that sapped investor sentiment in the Southeast Asian nation.
title: Philippine Senators to Face Plunder Charges in Graft Scandal

author: Colum Murphy, Jing Li, Yian Lee, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Beijing is using state media outlets to amplify its claims over Taiwan, a move likely intended to reinforce its position on a sensitive issue before a key meeting between Chinese leader Xi Jinping and President Donald Trump.
title: China Unleashes Media Blitz on Taiwan Before Xi-Trump Meeting

author: Helen Nyambura
description: Tanzanian elections are underway in a vote widely expected to deliver incumbent President Samia Suluhu Hassan an overwhelming victory after her main rivals were excluded from the poll.
title: Tanzania’s President Set to Sweep Vote With Rivals Barred

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung presented US President Donald Trump with a replica of a gold crown on display at the Gyeongju National Museum as the pair meet Wednesday on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit.
title: South Korea Gifts Trump Replica Gold Crown During APEC Visit

author: Eric Martin, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said that a tariff truce extension with Mexico announced by that nation’s leader on Tuesday is a positive step because the country already pays significant tariffs benefiting the US.
title: Trump Says He’s Happy With Tariff Truce Extension With Mexico

author: Lili Pike, Dan Murtaugh
description: A subtle change in language used by the Chinese government has left room for the world’s biggest coal user to prolong rising consumption through the end of the decade.
title: China’s New Coal Language Leaves More Room for Rising Use

author: Eric Martin, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump defended Israel’s strikes against members of Hamas and said he thinks that the peace deal he brokered earlier this month will hold despite rogue elements of the group attacking Israeli soldiers.
title: Trump Defends Israel Strikes on Hamas, Repeats Group Must Disarm

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump said he didn’t expect to meet with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un during his trip through Asia, despite previously suggesting he was open to coordinating a summit.
title: Trump Says He Won’t Meet Kim Jong Un Meet During Asia Trip

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump conceded Wednesday that it was “pretty clear” the Constitution didn’t allow him to seek a third term as president, despite frequently floating the idea in recent months.
title: Trump Says ‘Pretty Clear I’m Not Allowed to Run’ for Third Term

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Donald Trump said he expects to lower tariffs the US has imposed on Chinese goods over the fentanyl crisis and speak with China’s Xi Jinping about Nvidia Corp.’s flagship Blackwell artificial intelligence chip, as leaders of the world’s biggest economies seek to ease tensions in a meeting on Thursday.
title: Trump Expects to Cut Fentanyl Tariff, Discuss Nvidia in Xi Talks

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Ari Natter
description: The Trump administration is ruling out selling offshore oil and gas leases along the US East Coast, after its initial plan for auctioning them drew alarm from Republican strongholds in the Southeast.
title: Trump Administration Retreats on Push for Atlantic Oil Drilling

author: Erik Larson
description: A US appeals court agreed to reconsider a ruling that would allow President Donald Trump to send National Guard troops to Portland, Oregon, stalling the deployment again just as the state’s lawsuit challenging the plan heads to trial in a lower court.
title: Appeals Court to Review Order Letting Trump Send Guard to Oregon
